block.p: Hilary Batten Norman, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Stephen Peckham Norman of Rye, N.Y., was married there yesterday to Robert Erick Hawkins, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence Brooks Hawkins of Dallas. The Rev. Edward Johnston, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at Christ's Church.
The bride and bridegroom are graduates of Yale University, where they met as cross-country runners. In their senior year, they were the captains of their varsity cross-country teams.

Hilary Batten Norman, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Stephen Peckham Norman of Rye, N.Y., was married there yesterday to Robert Erick Hawkins, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence Brooks Hawkins of Dallas. The Rev. Edward Johnston, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at Christ's Church.
The bride and bridegroom are graduates of Yale University, where they met as cross-country runners. In their senior year, they were the captains of their varsity cross-country teams.

Mrs. Hawkins, 26, is studying at the University of North Carolina Medical School in Chapel Hill, where she worked until 1999 as a research technician in the cystic fibrosis laboratory. Her father is the corporate secretary of the American Express Company in New York.

Mr. Hawkins, 27, is known as Erick. He is a senior clinical research associate at Lineberry Research Associates, pharmaceuticals consultants in Research Triangle Park, N.C. His mother is an interior designer, and his father is the president of Investors Trust, investment managers, both in Dallas.
